page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Of the 228 replies to the question'What is your occupation?', 46% stated that they were retitred. Among the working population 30% are women.The public services employ 18% of the total;the building industry 14%;and retail & distribution 14%. Tourism was surprisingly low at 8% and farming with 7%(A figure probably due to intensive mechanisation).3% are unemployed.The remainder is made up of a wide variety of jobs. Over half work in Pelynt(30%) and Looe(21%) but 19% have to travel up to 15 miles and 10% commute to Plymouth each day(22mls).The remainder travel throughout the S.W.Three men work abroad. 65% travel to work by car or lorry.No one uses the bus service from Looe nor the branch line to Liskeard.2 use the Torpoint ferry to Plymouth each day.
